intro: Constantia microscopica, commonly known as the miniature constantia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Due to its small size and ornamental appeal, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
